relationships.reasoning: Aatrox is commonly played in the Top lane due to his fighter/tank nature.
Aatrox has significant healing from his passive Deathbringer Stance, Umbral Dash's passive Omnivamp, and amplified healing during World Ender.
Aatrox has multiple dashes with Umbral Dash and gains significant movement speed from World Ender.
Aatrox's The Darkin Blade (Q) can knock up enemies hit on the edge.
Aatrox relies heavily on his healing for sustain, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Aatrox's high mobility with dashes makes him vulnerable to abilities that stop or punish dashes.
Ahri is primarily played as a Mid lane champion.
Ahri's Spirit Rush (R) provides multiple dashes, making her highly mobile.
Ahri's Charm (E) stops movement abilities, acting as an anti-dash.
Ahri's reliance on high mobility from Spirit Rush makes her vulnerable to champions with Anti-Dash abilities that can lock her down.
Akali is commonly played in the Mid lane due to her assassin playstyle.
Akali's Twilight Shroud (W) grants her invisibility, making her untargetable.
Akali has multiple dashes with Shuriken Flip (E) and Perfect Execution (R), along with movement speed from Twilight Shroud (W), providing high mobility.
Akali's high mobility from her dashes makes her vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can lock her down or prevent her escapes.
Akshan is commonly played as a Mid lane champion due to his marksman/assassin nature.
Akshan's W (Going Rogue) grants him camouflage, a form of invisibility.
Akshan's E (Heroic Swing) provides high mobility through terrain swinging, and his Q and passive grant movement speed.
Akshan's R (Comeuppance) deals damage based on missing health.
Akshan's core mobility tool (Heroic Swing) is a dash, making him vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Alistar's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags.
Alistar's Pulverize (Q) ability knocks up enemies.
Alistar's Headbutt (W) ability knocks back enemies, which is a form of displacement similar to a knock up.
Alistar's Unbreakable Will (R) cleanses all disabling effects and reduces incoming damage, making him unstoppable for its duration.
Alistar's passive, Triumphant Roar, provides significant self and allied healing, contributing to high sustain.
Due to Alistar's High Sustain from his Triumphant Roar passive, he is weak to Grievous Wounds effects.
Amumu is commonly played as a Jungler due to his area-of-effect crowd control and tankiness.
Amumu's Despair (W) deals percentage maximum health magic damage to nearby enemies.
Anivia is a control mage commonly played in the mid lane due to her area control and high magic damage.
Anivia's Crystallize (W) creates an impassable wall of ice that blocks enemy movement and dashes.
Annie is typically played in the Mid lane as a mage.
Aphelios's 'Marksman' tag indicates he primarily plays in the Bot lane.
As a marksman, Aphelios relies heavily on basic attacks and many of his abilities are projectiles, making him vulnerable to projectile-blocking abilities.
Ashe is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Hawkshot grants vision and reveals units in brush.
Aurelion Sol is a Mage champion, primarily played in the Mid lane.
Comet of Legend (E) allows Aurelion Sol to fly long distances across the map, granting him high mobility.
Voice of Light (R) knocks back enemies to his outer limit.
Azir is primarily played as a Mage in the Mid lane.
Emperor's Divide (R) summons a wall of soldiers that charges forward, knocking back enemies.
Emperor's Divide (R) creates a wall of soldiers that blocks enemy paths, preventing dashes through it.
Bard is primarily played in the Support role as indicated by his tags.
Bard's Caretaker's Shrine (W) provides significant healing to allies, making him a high sustain champion.
Bard's Magical Journey (E) and passive provide significant map traversal and movement speed, making him highly mobile.
Champions with high sustain are weak to Grievous Wounds, which reduces their healing.
Champions with high mobility are weak to Anti-Dash mechanics that can stop their movement or dashes.
Blitzcrank is primarily played as a Support champion due to his Rocket Grab ability.
Power Fist causes Blitzcrank's next attack to knock up the target.
Static Field's active ability destroys nearby enemies' shields.
Blitzcrank's passive, Mana Barrier, gives him a shield when low on health, making him weak to shield destruction.
Brand is tagged as a Mage, and is commonly played in the mid lane due to his high magic damage and area-of-effect abilities.
Braum's tags include Support.
Braum's E (Unbreakable) blocks and destroys enemy projectiles.
Braum's R (Glacial Fissure) knocks up enemies.
Caitlyn is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Caitlyn's Yordle Snap Trap (W) and Ace in the Hole (R) provide True Sight.
Caitlyn's Yordle Snap Trap (W) roots enemies, stopping dashes within its area.
Camille is primarily played in the Top lane due to her skirmishing potential and scaling.
Camille's Tactical Sweep (W) deals max health physical damage to enemies in the outer cone, and The Hextech Ultimatum (R) deals current health magic damage.
Camille's Hookshot (E) allows her to dash twice, covering significant distances and providing strong engagement and escape potential.
Camille's Hookshot (E) knocks up enemy champions upon landing, and The Hextech Ultimatum (R) knocks away other nearby enemies.
Camille briefly becomes Untargetable during the cast of The Hextech Ultimatum (R), making her immune to crowd control and damage.
Camille's The Hextech Ultimatum (R) locks an enemy champion into an area they cannot escape by any means, effectively preventing dashes out of the zone.
Camille relies on her High Mobility from Hookshot (E) for engagement and escape, making her vulnerable to abilities that stop or prevent dashes.
Cassiopeia is a Mage champion typically played in the Mid lane.
Cassiopeia's Miasma (W) grounds enemies, preventing them from using movement abilities or dashes.
Cho'Gath is often played as a tank in the Top lane due to his scaling health and crowd control.
Rupture (Q) knocks enemies into the air.
Vorpal Spikes (E) deals bonus magic damage based on the target's maximum health.
Carnivore (Passive) allows Cho'Gath to recover Health and Mana whenever he kills a unit, providing significant sustain in lane and jungle.
Cho'Gath's sustain from his Carnivore passive and Feast makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds, which reduces his healing.
Marksman champions typically play in the Bot lane.
Phosphorus Bomb reveals enemies in an area.
Empowered Valkyrie with The Package can Knock Aside enemies.
Valkyrie allows Corki to fly a short distance, and with The Package, a much greater distance, granting high mobility.
Corki's mobility from Valkyrie can be countered by anti-dash abilities.
Darius is primarily played as a Top Lane champion due to his strong dueling and sustained damage.
Darius's Decimate (Q) heals him for a percentage of his missing health per enemy champion and large monster hit, allowing for significant sustain in prolonged engagements.
Darius's Apprehend (E) pulls enemies towards him and briefly knocks them up.
Darius relies on his Decimate (Q) for healing, which can be significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds effects.
Diana is commonly played in the Mid lane due to her burst damage and ability to roam.
Diana can also be played in the Jungle due to her AoE clear and ganking potential.
Diana's Crescent Strike (Q) afflicts enemies with Moonlight, revealing them if they are not stealthed.
Diana's Lunar Rush (E) allows her to dash to enemies, with the cooldown refreshing if the target is afflicted with Moonlight, enabling multiple dashes.
As a champion with High Mobility from her Lunar Rush (E), Diana is weak to champions with Anti-Dash mechanics that can stop her engages.
Draven is a Marksman, which primarily plays in the Bot lane.
Draven's Blood Rush (W) grants him significant and refreshable movement speed.
Draven's Stand Aside (E) knocks back and slows enemies, which can interrupt dashes.
Draven's Stand Aside (E) provides a knock back effect.
As a champion with High Mobility, Draven is vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can immobilize him.
As a Marksman, Draven is projectile reliant for his primary damage output from auto-attacks and Spinning Axes (Q).
Dr. Mundo is commonly played in the jungle and his ally tips suggest farming neutral monsters.
Dr. Mundo's kit, including his passive, Q, W, and ultimate, provides significant health regeneration and healing, making him highly sustainable.
Dr. Mundo's passive, 'Goes Where He Pleases', allows him to resist the first immobilizing effect, making him temporarily unstoppable against crowd control.
Dr. Mundo's Infected Bonesaw (Q) deals magic damage based on the enemy's current health.
Dr. Mundo is highly reliant on his considerable healing and health regeneration, making him vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Ekko is commonly played in the mid lane as an assassin.
Ekko's W passive deals bonus magic damage based on missing health to low health enemies.
Ekko's Phase Dive (E) is a dash, and his Z-Drive Resonance (Passive) grants a burst of movement speed.
Ekko's ultimate, Chronobreak, makes him untargetable during his rewind, allowing him to ignore many crowd control effects.
Ekko's ultimate, Chronobreak, provides significant healing based on damage taken, which is a key part of his survivability and sustain.
Ekko gains a shield from his Parallel Convergence (W), making him vulnerable to effects that destroy shields.
Ekko's ultimate, Chronobreak, provides significant healing, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Ekko relies heavily on his Phase Dive (E) and passive movement speed for mobility, making him vulnerable to anti-dash effects.
Elise's kit is well-suited for ganking and jungle clear, making her a primary Jungler.
Elise's Human Form Cocoon (E) reveals stealthed enemies.
Elise's Spider Form Rappel (E) allows her to become untargetable and reposition, providing significant evasive and engagement mobility.
Elise's Human Form Neurotoxin (Q) deals damage based on current health, and Spider Form Venomous Bite (Q) deals damage based on missing health.
Elise's high mobility from Rappel can be countered by anti-dash effects if she attempts to escape or engage after landing.
Evelynn is primarily played as a Jungler, utilizing her stealth for ganks and objective control.
Demon Shade grants Camouflage after level 6, allowing Evelynn to become invisible to most enemies.
Demon Shade heals Evelynn when she is low on health while out of combat, providing significant sustain between engagements.
Whiplash (E) deals percent max Health magic damage, especially when empowered.
Evelynn's Demon Shade provides High Sustain, making her weak to Grievous Wounds which reduces her healing.
Evelynn's Camouflage (invisibility) can be countered by True Sight, revealing her position.
Ezreal is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Ezreal's Arcane Shift (E) allows him to teleport, providing high mobility for dodging and positioning.
Ezreal is highly reliant on his Mystic Shot (Q) and Trueshot Barrage (R) being projectiles, which can be blocked.
Fiddlesticks is primarily played as a Jungler, utilizing his surprise ganks and sustain from unseen positions.
Fiddlesticks' Bountiful Harvest (W) drains health from nearby enemies, providing significant self-healing.
Fiddlesticks' Terrify (Q) deals current health magic damage, and Bountiful Harvest (W) deals missing health magic damage.
Fiddlesticks' passive effigies grant vision around them, acting as a form of True Sight.
Due to his High Sustain from Bountiful Harvest (W), Fiddlesticks is significantly weakened by Grievous Wounds effects that reduce his healing.
Fiora is primarily played in the Top lane.
Fiora's Lunge (Q) is a dash, and her passive and ultimate grant significant movement speed bonuses.
Fiora's Riposte (W) parries all incoming damage and disables for a short time, making her immune to crowd control.
Fiora's Riposte (W) parries all incoming damage, including auto attacks, for a short duration.
Fiora's Duelist's Dance passive and Grand Challenge ultimate deal true damage based on target's max health when Vitals are struck.
Fiora's Grand Challenge (R) provides significant healing to herself and allies upon successfully striking Vitals, making it a key part of her sustain.
Fiora's Grand Challenge (R) provides substantial healing, making her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects that reduce healing.
Fiora's mobility, largely from Lunge (Q) and passive movement speed, makes her vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes or restrict movement.
Fizz is commonly played as a Mid lane Assassin.
Fizz's Urchin Strike (Q) is a dash, and Playful/Trickster (E) allows him to hop and dash, providing high mobility.
Fizz's Playful/Trickster (E) makes him untargetable, effectively ignoring crowd control for its duration.
Fizz's ultimate ability, Chum the Waters (R), afflicts the victim with True Sight.
Fizz's ultimate ability, Chum the Waters (R), knocks up its target.
As a high mobility champion who relies on dashes, Fizz is weak to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Galio's E (Justice Punch) and R (Hero's Entrance) abilities both feature a Knock Up.
Galio can cast and release his W (Shield of Durand) ability even while crowd controlled, making him temporarily unstoppable during this action.
Galio's Shield of Durand (W) taunts enemies, effectively stopping their dashes and movement.
Galio's passive shield from Shield of Durand (W) and the shields granted to allies by Hero's Entrance (R) make him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Gangplank is commonly played in the Top lane due to his scaling, zoning with barrels, and lane sustain.
Gangplank can also be played in the Mid lane, offering global ultimate pressure and strong burst damage with his barrels.
Gangplank's Remove Scurvy (W) cleanses all disabling effects, making him briefly unstoppable.
Gangplank's Remove Scurvy (W) provides a significant burst heal, contributing to high sustain.
Gangplank's significant healing from Remove Scurvy (W) makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Garen is commonly played in the Top lane due to his durable nature and lane sustain.
Garen's passive, Perseverance, grants significant health regeneration when out of combat.
Garen's ultimate, Demacian Justice, deals true damage based on the target's missing health.
Garen's high sustain from his passive makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds, which reduces his healing.
Gnar is a Fighter/Tank champion commonly played in the Top lane.
Mini Gnar's Hyper (W) deals percent max Health magic damage.
Mini Gnar's Hop (E) is a leap, and Hyper (W) grants movement speed, making him highly mobile.
Mega Gnar's ultimate, GNAR! (R), knocks back enemies.
Gnar has High Mobility with his E (Hop), making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Gragas is commonly played as a Jungler due to his ganking potential and area control.
Gragas is also viable in the Top lane, leveraging his sustain and engage.
Gragas can be played in the Mid lane, utilizing his burst damage and crowd control.
Drunken Rage (W) deals percent max health magic damage.
Body Slam (E) and Explosive Cask (R) knock up or knock away enemies.
His Barrel Roll (Q) and Explosive Cask (R) are projectiles and can be blocked.
Graves is primarily played in the jungle role due to his strong clear and ganking potential.
Graves' Quickdraw (E) allows him to frequently dash and reposition, especially when chaining auto-attacks, providing high mobility.
Graves relies on his Quickdraw (E) for repositioning and combat, making him vulnerable to champions with anti-dash abilities that can stop his movement.
Gwen is a melee fighter champion often played in the top lane due to her dueling potential, sustain, and area control.
Gwen's passive 'A Thousand Cuts' deals bonus magic damage based on the target's health.
Gwen's passive 'A Thousand Cuts' heals her for a portion of the damage dealt to champions.
Gwen's high sustain from her passive makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Hecarim's kit, including high movement speed, sustained damage, and crowd control, makes him an effective Jungler.
Hecarim's Devastating Charge (E) provides significant movement speed, and his passive Warpath converts bonus move speed into attack damage, making mobility a core part of his gameplay.
Hecarim's Spirit of Dread (W) provides substantial healing based on damage dealt to enemies within its area, contributing to his survivability in fights.
Due to Hecarim's High Sustain from Spirit of Dread (W), he is vulnerable to Grievous Wounds which reduces his healing.
Hecarim relies heavily on his High Mobility to engage and disengage, making him vulnerable to abilities that can stop or slow his movement and dashes.
Heimerdinger is tagged as a Support champion.
Heimerdinger's CH-2 Electron Storm Grenade (E) stuns enemies in an area, stopping dashes and movement.
Heimerdinger's primary damage sources, his H-28 G Evolution Turrets (Q) and Hextech Micro-Rockets (W), are projectiles and can be blocked.
Illaoi is typically played in the Top lane due to her bruiser/juggernaut playstyle.
Illaoi's passive heals her when tentacles damage champions, providing significant sustain.
Illaoi's W, Harsh Lesson, deals physical damage based on the target's max health.
Illaoi relies heavily on the healing from her tentacles, making her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Irelia is primarily played in the Top lane as a fighter.
Bladesurge (Q) allows for multiple dashes by refreshing its cooldown on marked or killed targets.
Defiant Dance (W) is not interrupted by crowd control, making her unstoppable during the channel.
As a high mobility champion relying on dashes, Irelia is weak to abilities that stop or prevent dashes.
Ivern's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags and kit.
Daisy! (R) can knock up enemies with her shockwave.
Ivern's Triggerseed (E) provides shields, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Janna's kit is designed to aid allies and she is primarily played as a Support.
Janna's Howling Gale (Q) knocks up enemies and Monsoon (R) knocks back enemies.
Janna's Zephyr (W) passive grants her bonus movement speed and her passive Tailwind grants movement speed towards allies.
Janna's Monsoon (R) heals nearby allies over time, providing significant team sustain.
Janna's ally healing from Monsoon (R) is countered by Grievous Wounds.
Janna's Eye of the Storm (E) provides shields, making her weak to shield reave mechanics.
Janna relies on her high movement speed for positioning, making her vulnerable to abilities that restrict movement or stop dashes.
Jarvan IV is a strong jungler with good ganking potential and area control.
Jarvan IV's Dragon Strike (Q) combined with Demacian Standard (E) knocks up enemies.
Jarvan IV's Martial Cadence (passive) deals bonus physical damage based on the enemy's current health.
Jarvan IV's Cataclysm (R) creates an impassable arena that stops movement abilities and dashes attempting to cross it.
Jax is a dominant duelist and scaler commonly played in the Top lane.
Jax's Counter Strike (E) allows him to dodge all incoming basic attacks for a short duration.
Jayce is commonly played as a Top laner.
Jayce gains movement speed from his Hextech Capacitor passive when swapping stances and has a leap (To the Skies!) for mobility.
Jayce's Thundering Blow (Hammer E) deals magic damage based on the target's max health.
Jayce's Thundering Blow (Hammer E) knocks back his target.
Jayce relies on his Shock Blast (Cannon Q) projectile for poke and ranged damage, making him vulnerable to projectile blocking abilities.
Jayce's kit includes High Mobility, making him susceptible to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Jhin is categorized as a Marksman, which primarily plays in the Bot lane.
Jhin's ultimate, Curtain Call, deals damage based on the target's missing health.
As a Marksman, Jhin's damage output relies heavily on auto-attacks and abilities, which are projectiles, making him vulnerable to projectile blocking mechanics.
Jinx is a Marksman champion, typically played in the Bot lane.
Jinx's Zap! (W) reveals enemies hit for a duration.
Jinx's Flame Chompers! (E) root enemies in a set area, stopping dashes.
Jinx's Super Mega Death Rocket! (R) deals damage based on the target's missing health.
Jinx is heavily reliant on her basic attacks, Zap! (W), and Super Mega Death Rocket! (R), all of which are projectiles that can be blocked.
Kai'Sa is classified as a Marksman, primarily playing the Bot lane.
Void Seeker (W) grants True Sight on the first enemy hit.
Evolved Supercharge (E) grants Kai'Sa a brief period of Invisibility.
Supercharge (E) provides movement speed and Killer Instinct (R) is a long-range dash, indicating high mobility.
Due to her High Mobility (Supercharge, Killer Instinct), Kai'Sa is weak to champions with Anti-Dash mechanics.
Kalista is a Marksman, a role typically played in the Bot lane.
Kalista's passive, Martial Poise, grants her a lunge after every basic attack or Pierce, providing high mobility.
Kalista's Sentinel ability sends a ghost to scout, revealing champions it spots.
Kalista's Sentinel passive deals a percentage of the target's max health as magic damage when she and her Oathsworn attack the same target.
Kalista's ultimate, Fate's Call, allows her Oathsworn ally to dash and knock back enemies, which is a form of knock up.
Kalista's high mobility from her passive makes her vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Kalista's primary damage comes from her auto-attacks and Pierce (Q), both of which are projectiles and can be blocked.
Karma is primarily played as a support champion.
Karma's Mantra-empowered Focused Resolve (RW) provides significant self-healing.
Karma's Focused Resolve (W) reveals targeted enemies for 2 seconds.
Karma's self-healing from Mantra-empowered W makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Karma's Inspire (E) provides shields to allies, making her vulnerable to Shield Reave.
Karthus is classified as a Mage champion who is often played in the Mid lane.
Karthus is also a strong pick in the Jungle due to his area-of-effect abilities for clearing camps and global ultimate presence.
Kassadin is primarily played as a Mid lane champion.
Kassadin's ultimate, Riftwalk, allows him to teleport repeatedly with a short cooldown, providing high mobility.
Kassadin's high mobility from Riftwalk makes him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can lock him down.
Katarina is primarily played as a Mid Laner.
Katarina's Shunpo (E) is a low cooldown dash that resets on dagger pickup, providing extreme mobility.
Katarina's Death Lotus (R) applies Grievous Wounds, reducing enemy healing.
As a highly mobile champion with multiple dashes, Katarina is weak to Anti-Dash abilities that restrict her movement.
Kayle is commonly played as a Fighter in the Top lane.
Kayle is often played as a scaling champion in the Mid lane.
Kayle is listed with the 'Support' tag in her champion data.
Kayle's Starfire Spellblade (E) active deals bonus magic damage proportionate to the target's missing health.
Kayn is a prominent jungler known for his unique transformation mechanic which allows him to adapt to team needs.
Kayn's Shadow Step (E) allows him to move through terrain and gains significant movement speed, and his Reaping Slash (Q) includes a dash.
Kayn's Darkin form deals percent health damage with Reaping Slash (Q) and Umbral Trespass (R).
Kayn's Darkin form's Blade's Reach (W) knocks up enemies.
Kayn's Darkin form offers significant healing from his passive, The Darkin Scythe, and his ultimate, Umbral Trespass (R).
Kayn becomes untargetable during his Umbral Trespass (R), effectively ignoring crowd control.
Kayn's Darkin form relies heavily on healing, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Kayn's mobility, especially his Shadow Step (E), can be interrupted by anti-dash abilities or hard crowd control.
Kennen is commonly played in the Top lane due to his ranged harass and strong all-in potential.
Kennen's Lightning Rush (E) allows him to gain significant movement speed and pass through units, making him highly mobile for engagements and escapes.
As a champion with High Mobility, Kennen is vulnerable to Anti-Dash mechanics that can interrupt his Lightning Rush or prevent his engagement/disengagement.
Kha'Zix is a prominent Jungler due to his burst damage, isolation mechanic, and mobility for ganks.
Kha'Zix's ultimate, Void Assault (R), grants him invisibility.
Evolved Void Spike (W) reveals enemy champions hit for 2 seconds.
Kha'Zix's Leap (E) allows him to dash, and Void Assault (R) increases his movement speed. Evolved Leap resets on takedowns.
Kha'Zix relies heavily on his mobility and dashes, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Kindred's allytips mention 'jungling' and 'Hunts on jungle camps' indicating primary role.
Kindred's Q, Dance of Arrows, is a vault (dash) with a low cooldown inside Wolf's Frenzy, providing significant mobility.
Kindred's W, Wolf's Frenzy, passive provides health restoration based on missing health after accumulating stacks.
Kindred's E, Mounting Dread, deals missing Health physical damage with Wolf's pounce.
Kindred's R, Lamb's Respite, prevents units inside the zone from dying.
Kindred has High Sustain from Wolf's Frenzy passive, making them weak to Grievous Wounds.
Kled is commonly played in the Top lane.
Kled's Q applies Grievous Wounds to enemies.
Kled's W and R deal bonus physical damage based on the target's max health.
Kled's R briefly knocks back the first enemy champion hit.
Kled's E provides a dash and his R is a very long-range charge, granting him high engagement and chase potential.
Kled's primary engagement and escape tools are dashes (E) and charges (R), making him vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Kog'Maw is a Marksman champion primarily played in the Bot lane.
Kog'Maw's Bio-Arcane Barrage (W) causes his attacks to deal a percent of the target's maximum health as magic damage.
Kog'Maw's Living Artillery (R) reveals non-stealthed targets hit for 2 seconds.
Kog'Maw relies heavily on auto-attacks and skill shots (Q, R), making him vulnerable to abilities that block projectiles.
LeBlanc is a burst mage and assassin frequently played in the mid lane.
LeBlanc's Distortion (W) is a dash ability that allows her to reposition quickly and return to her starting point, granting high mobility.
LeBlanc's passive, Mirror Image, grants her invisibility for 1 second when her health drops below 40%.
LeBlanc's Ethereal Chains (E) applies True Sight to the shackled target.
Due to her reliance on Distortion (W) for mobility, LeBlanc is vulnerable to Anti-Dash abilities that can trap her or prevent her return.
LeBlanc's Sigil of Malice (Q) and Ethereal Chains (E) are projectiles that can be blocked by abilities that destroy missiles.
Lee Sin is primarily played in the jungle role.
Sonic Wave (Q) and Tempest (E) grant True Sight on hit.
Resonating Strike (Q2) and Safeguard (W1) provide multiple dashes, making him highly mobile.
Resonating Strike (Q2) deals physical damage based on the target's missing Health.
Dragon's Rage (R) knocks enemies into the air.
As a highly mobile champion, Lee Sin is vulnerable to effects that stop or limit dashes.
Leona is primarily played as a Support champion due to her crowd control and defensive capabilities.
Leona's Zenith Blade roots targets, and her Solar Flare stuns enemies in an area, both effectively stopping dashes.
Lillia is primarily played as a Jungler due to her clear speed and gank potential.
Lillia's passive, Dream-Laden Bough, deals max Health damage over time to champions and monsters.
Lillia gains stacking movement speed from her Q (Blooming Blows) when hitting enemies, enabling high mobility for kiting and positioning.
Lillia's reliance on movement speed makes her vulnerable to effects that prevent her movement or dashes.
Lissandra is a mage champion often played in the mid lane.
Lissandra's Ring of Frost (W) roots nearby enemies, stopping movement and dashes within its area.
Lucian is a Marksman, primarily played in the Bot lane.
Ardent Blaze (W) briefly reveals enemies.
Relentless Pursuit (E) is a dash that can be frequently reset, and Ardent Blaze (W) grants movement speed.
Lucian's primary mobility comes from his dash (E), making him vulnerable to champions with Anti-Dash mechanics.
Lulu's primary role is Support, as indicated by her champion tags and kit.
Lulu's E, Help, Pix!, grants True Sight on enemies.
Lulu's R, Wild Growth, knocks up surrounding enemies.
Lulu's E provides significant shielding for allies, making her and her protected targets vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Lux is frequently played as a Support.
Lucent Singularity (E) reveals an area, providing true sight.
Lux's primary damage and crowd control abilities, Light Binding (Q) and Lucent Singularity (E), are projectiles that can be blocked.
Lux's Prismatic Barrier (W) provides significant shielding for herself and allies, making her vulnerable to abilities that remove shields.
Malphite is commonly played in the Top lane as a tank and initiator.
Malphite's ultimate ability, Unstoppable Force (R), makes him unstoppable during its dash.
Malphite's ultimate ability, Unstoppable Force (R), knocks up enemies upon impact.
Malphite relies on his passive, Granite Shield, for durability, making him vulnerable to effects that destroy shields.
Malzahar is tagged as a Mage, typically playing in the Mid lane.
Malzahar's passive, Void Shift, grants crowd control immunity.
Malzahar's ultimate, Nether Grasp, creates a zone that deals percent max Health magic damage.
Aurelion Sol is commonly played as a Mid Laner.
Voice of Light (R) knocks enemies back.
Comet of Legend (E) allows Aurelion Sol to fly for long distances at high speeds.
Aurelion Sol's Comet of Legend (E) provides high mobility, making him weak to abilities that stop dashes and movement.
Cho'Gath is a tank champion often played in the top lane due to his sustain and crowd control.
Cho'Gath can be played in the jungle due to his sustain and clear speed.
Cho'Gath can be played as a mage/tank in the mid lane.
Rupture (Q) knocks up enemies.
Vorpal Spikes (E) deals percent max health magic damage.
Cho'Gath's passive, Carnivore, provides significant health and mana regeneration upon killing units.
Cho'Gath's high sustain from Carnivore makes him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Dr. Mundo is a tanky fighter often played in the top lane due to his sustain and damage.
Dr. Mundo can clear jungle camps efficiently with his sustain and percentage health damage on Q.
Dr. Mundo's passive, Q, W, and Ultimate all provide significant health regeneration and healing, making him incredibly hard to kill.
Dr. Mundo's passive 'Goes Where He Pleases' resists the first immobilizing effect that hits him, allowing him to ignore its full duration.
Dr. Mundo's Q, 'Infected Bonesaw', deals magic damage based on the target's current health.
Dr. Mundo's kit heavily relies on health regeneration and healing, which Grievous Wounds directly counters by reducing healing effectiveness.
Jarvan IV is a strong jungler with good ganks and clear speed.
Jarvan IV can be played in the top lane as a fighter/tank.
Jarvan IV's passive, Martial Cadence, deals bonus physical damage based on the enemy's current health.
Jarvan IV's Dragon Strike (Q) combined with Demacian Standard (E) knocks up enemies in its path.
Kai'Sa is tagged as a Marksman, commonly played in the Bot lane.
Void Seeker (W) grants True Sight on the first enemy hit.
Evolved Supercharge (E) grants invisibility.
Supercharge (E) provides a significant movement speed boost, and Killer Instinct (R) allows for a dash to an enemy champion.
Kai'Sa's mobility, especially her ultimate, makes her vulnerable to anti-dash abilities that can lock her down.
Kha'Zix is primarily played as an Assassin in the Jungle role due to his isolation mechanics and ganking potential.
Kha'Zix's Void Assault (R) grants him invisibility, which can be extended and used multiple times when evolved.
Kha'Zix has a powerful dash (E - Leap) that can reset on champion takedowns when evolved, and his ultimate (R - Void Assault) provides movement speed for repositioning.
When evolved, Void Spike (W) reveals enemy champions hit for 2 seconds.
As a highly mobile champion, Kha'Zix is vulnerable to abilities that restrict or stop dashes.
Kog'Maw is a Marksman, typically played in the Bot lane.
Kog'Maw's Bio-Arcane Barrage (W) causes his attacks to deal a percentage of the target's maximum health as magic damage.
Kog'Maw's Living Artillery (R) reveals non-stealthed targets.
Kog'Maw relies on several projectile abilities (Q, R) and his empowered auto-attacks (W) are also projectiles, making him vulnerable to projectile-blocking abilities.
LeBlanc is primarily played in the Mid lane due to her burst damage and mobility.
LeBlanc's Distortion (W) allows her to dash to a location and return, providing high mobility.
LeBlanc's Ethereal Chains (E) grants True Sight on the shackled target.
LeBlanc's passive, Mirror Image, grants her invisibility when her health is low.
LeBlanc's high mobility from Distortion (W) makes her vulnerable to Anti-Dash mechanics that can lock her down or prevent her escapes.
Lee Sin is primarily played in the Jungle role.
Lee Sin has multiple dashes with his Q (Resonating Strike) and W (Safeguard) abilities, allowing for high maneuverability.
Sonic Wave grants True Sight on the first enemy hit.
Dragon's Rage knocks up enemies that collide with the primary target.
Iron Will grants Lee Sin Lifesteal and Spell Vamp, contributing to his sustain.
Lee Sin's Iron Will grants him sustain, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Lee Sin's high mobility with dashes makes him susceptible to abilities that stop dashes.
Maokai is commonly played as a tank in the Top lane.
Maokai's Saplings provide vision and clear for jungle pathing, and his crowd control makes for effective ganks.
Maokai provides strong crowd control and tankiness, making him viable as a Support.
Maokai's passive, Sap Magic, heals him on a moderate cooldown, which is reduced by casting or being struck by spells, providing significant self-healing.
Maokai's Q, Bramble Smash, knocks back nearby enemies.
Maokai's E, Sapling Toss, deals magic damage plus max Health magic damage to enemies.
Maokai has High Sustain from his passive, making him weak to healing reduction effects.
Master Yi is primarily played in the Jungle role due to his strong clear and gank potential.
Master Yi's Alpha Strike allows him to teleport and his Highlander ultimate provides a significant boost to movement speed, making his kit highly mobile.
Master Yi's Meditate ability provides substantial self-healing, allowing him to sustain health in fights and in the jungle.
Master Yi's Highlander ultimate makes him immune to all slowing effects, which counts as ignoring a form of crowd control.
Due to his High Sustain from Meditate, Master Yi is vulnerable to Grievous Wounds, which reduces his healing.
As a High Mobility champion that relies on movement and Alpha Strike for positioning, Master Yi is vulnerable to Anti-Dash effects that can stop his movements.
Miss Fortune is a Marksman champion primarily played in the Bot lane.
Miss Fortune's Make It Rain reveals an area, granting True Sight.
Miss Fortune's primary damage abilities, Double Up and Bullet Time, are projectile-based and can be blocked.
Wukong is commonly played in the Top lane.
Wukong's W (Warrior Trickster) makes him Invisible.
Wukong has multiple dashes with Warrior Trickster (W) and Nimbus Strike (E), and gains movement speed from Cyclone (R).
Wukong's ultimate ability, Cyclone (R), knocks up nearby enemies.
Wukong's ultimate ability, Cyclone (R), deals percent max Health physical damage.
Wukong's dashes can be interrupted by Anti-Dash mechanics.
Mordekaiser is commonly played in the Top lane due to his durable kit and strong dueling potential.
Mordekaiser's Indestructible (W) allows him to store damage as a shield and consume it to heal for a significant amount, making sustain a core part of his gameplay.
Mordekaiser relies on his Indestructible (W) shield for durability, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave abilities that destroy shields.
Mordekaiser's Indestructible (W) provides significant healing, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects that reduce healing.
Mordekaiser relies on his Indestructible (W) shield for durability, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave abilities that destroy shields.
Morgana is officially tagged as a support champion and excels in this role due to her crowd control and defensive utility.
Morgana can also be played as a control mage in the mid lane due to her wave clear and pick potential.
Morgana's Black Shield grants an ally immunity to disabling and immobilizing effects.
Tormented Shadow deals increased damage based on the target's missing health, applying a form of percent health damage.
Morgana's passive, Soul Siphon, grants her significant healing whenever she deals damage to champions, large minions, and monsters, providing high sustain.
Morgana's healing from Soul Siphon is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds effects.
Morgana's Black Shield, a key defensive ability, can be removed by Shield Reave effects, negating its crowd control immunity and magic damage absorption.
Morgana's Dark Binding (Q), her primary long-range crowd control, can be entirely negated by projectile blocking abilities.
Nami is designated as a Support champion in her champion tags and kit design.
Nami's W (Ebb and Flow) is a core healing ability that bounces between allies and enemies.
Nami's Q (Aqua Prison) stuns and her R (Tidal Wave) knocks up, both interrupting dashes in an area.
Nami's ultimate, Tidal Wave, knocks up enemies.
Nami's primary healing ability (Ebb and Flow) is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds.
Nasus is commonly played as a Top laner.
His passive, Soul Eater, grants him bonus lifesteal.
Fury of the Sands (R) deals magic damage based on nearby enemies' maximum Health.
His high sustain from Soul Eater is countered by Grievous Wounds.
Nasus is prone to being kited by champions with high mobility due to his lack of inherent dashes, as indicated in his enemy tips.
Nautilus is a tank champion often played as a support due to his strong crowd control and engagement tools.
Nautilus' ultimate ability, Depth Charge, knocks up its target and enemies in its path.
Nautilus gains a temporary shield from Titan's Wrath (W) for survivability, making him vulnerable to shield removal.
Neeko's kit offers crowd control and utility, making her suitable for the Support role.
Neeko's Inherent Glamour (Passive) allows her to disguise as an ally, and Shapesplitter (W) grants her invisibility.
Neeko's primary damage ability (Q - Blooming Burst) and crowd control ability (E - Tangle-Barbs) are projectiles, making her vulnerable to projectile blocking mechanics.
Nidalee is a master tracker who thrives in the jungle, using her mobility and traps to clear camps and gank lanes effectively.
Nidalee's passive grants significant bonus movement speed in brush and towards hunted targets, and her Cougar form Pounce provides multiple dashes for rapid repositioning.
Nidalee's passive applies the 'Hunt' debuff which grants True Sight on champions or monsters hit by Javelin Toss or Bushwhack.
Nidalee's Bushwhack traps deal magic damage per second based on the victim's current Health.
Nidalee's primary initiation and long-range poke, Javelin Toss, is a crucial projectile that can be blocked by abilities like Yasuo's Wind Wall.
Nidalee's high mobility is heavily reliant on her Pounce dashes in Cougar form, making her vulnerable to abilities that prevent or interrupt dashes.
Nocturne's kit, with his global ultimate and ganking potential, makes him a strong jungle champion.
Duskbringer (Q) provides increased movement speed, and Paranoia (R) allows a long-range dash to enemy champions.
Paranoia (R) darkens the map, reducing enemy sight radius and removing ally vision, effectively concealing Nocturne's approach.
Nocturne's engagements often rely on his dash from Paranoia and enhanced movement speed, making him vulnerable to abilities that prevent or interrupt dashes.
Nunu & Willump is primarily played as a Jungler, utilizing Consume for healthy clears and Biggest Snowball Ever for ganks.
Nunu's Q (Consume) provides significant self-healing, especially at low health, for jungle clears and dueling.
Nunu's W (Biggest Snowball Ever!) knocks up enemies upon collision, providing crowd control.
Nunu's W (Biggest Snowball Ever!) grants him high movement speed for engaging, ganking, and traversing the map.
Nunu's primary sustain comes from his Q, making him vulnerable to healing reduction effects.
Nunu relies on his W for mobility and engaging, which can be interrupted or stopped by abilities that block dashes or movement.
Olaf's Vicious Strikes grants Life Steal and increased healing based on missing health.
Olaf's Ragnarok makes him immune to disables.
Olaf's High Sustain from Vicious Strikes is countered by healing reduction effects.
Orianna is a control mage frequently played in the mid lane.
Orianna's tags include Support, and her Command: Protect ability offers shields and resistances to allies.
Orianna's ultimate ability, Command: Shockwave, knocks up enemies towards her ball.
Orianna's Command: Protect ability provides shields, making her or her shielded allies vulnerable to shield reave effects.
Orianna's Command: Attack fires her ball as a projectile that can be blocked.
Ornn is typically played in the top lane due to his tankiness and ability to scale.
Ornn's Bellows Breath (W) makes him unstoppable during the channel.
Ornn's Bellows Breath (W) deals max Health magic damage to enemies.
Ornn's Searing Charge (E) knocks up enemies if he collides with terrain, and his Call of the Forge God (R) can knock up enemies on recast.
Pantheon is a Fighter often played in the Top lane.
Pantheon's Aegis Assault (E) makes him immune to non-tower damage from the front, blocking projectiles.
Pantheon's Aegis Assault (E) makes him immune to non-tower damage from the front, blocking auto attacks.
Pantheon's primary poke and damage ability, Comet Spear (Q), is a projectile, making him vulnerable to abilities that block projectiles.
Poppy is commonly played in the top lane due to her tankiness, CC, and anti-dash capabilities.
Poppy's W, Steadfast Presence, actively stops enemy dashes within its area.
Poppy's Q, Hammer Shock, deals percentage max Health physical damage.
Poppy's R, Keeper's Verdict, can knock up enemies with an uncharged swing.
Poppy's Iron Ambassador passive grants her a temporary shield, making her vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Pyke's kit makes him ideal for the Support role with his crowd control and execution potential.
Gift of the Drowned Ones allows Pyke to regenerate damage taken from champions when hidden.
Pyke's high sustain from Gift of the Drowned Ones can be countered by Grievous Wounds.
Ghostwater Dive grants Pyke Camouflage, making him hidden from enemies.
Ghostwater Dive grants significant decaying Move Speed, and Phantom Undertow is a dash ability.
Pyke relies on Phantom Undertow's dash and Ghostwater Dive's movement speed for mobility, making him vulnerable to anti-dash abilities.
Qiyana is primarily played as a Mid lane assassin.
Qiyana has multiple dashes (W, E) and movement speed buffs (Q-Wild, W passive) that make her highly mobile.
Qiyana's Q with Wild Enchantment grants her invisibility.

Qiyana's ultimate ability deals bonus damage based on the target's missing health or max health depending on the tooltip interpretation, with the ultimate explicitly stating 'max Health physical damage'.
Qiyana's ultimate ability 'Knocks Back' enemies, which is a form of Knock Up.
As a highly mobile champion with multiple dashes, Qiyana is weak to abilities that stop or prevent dashes.
Quinn is a marksman champion often played in the bot lane.
Blinding Assault (Q) reduces enemy vision radius, effectively blinding them and hindering their auto-attacks.
Heightened Senses (W) active reveals a large area nearby.
Heightened Senses (W) passive grants significant move speed, Vault (E) is a dash, and Behind Enemy Lines (R) grants high movement speed.
Vault (E) slightly knocks back the target, which is a form of displacement.
As a marksman, Quinn relies heavily on auto-attacks and Blinding Assault (Q), which are projectiles, making her vulnerable to abilities that block them.
Quinn relies on her Vault (E) and ultimate (R) for mobility, making her vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Rakan's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags.
Rakan's Grand Entrance (W) ability knocks up nearby enemies.
Rakan's kit heavily revolves around dashes (W, E) and movement speed (R).
Rakan's passive (Fey Feathers) and Battle Dance (E) provide shields, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Rakan has High Mobility due to multiple dashes, making him weak to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Rammus is primarily played as a Jungler.
Powerball grants Rammus significant movement speed, making him highly mobile.
Powerball knocks back enemies on impact, and Soaring Slam can knock up enemies when cast during Powerball.
Defensive Ball Curl significantly increases Rammus's armor and magic resistance and returns damage to enemies that basic attack him.
As a champion with High Mobility from Powerball, Rammus is weak to effects that stop or limit movement.
Rek'Sai is primarily played as a Jungler.
Rek'Sai's Un-burrow (W) can knock up nearby enemies.
Rek'Sai gains increased move speed while burrowed (W) and creates re-usable tunnels (E) for quick traversal.
Rek'Sai consumes Fury while Burrowed to restore health with her passive, Fury of the Xer'Sai.
Rek'Sai's Void Rush (R) deals bonus physical damage based on the target's missing health.
Rek'Sai becomes unstoppable during her Void Rush (R) lunge.
Rek'Sai's High Sustain from her passive makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Rek'Sai's High Mobility with tunnels and ultimate makes her vulnerable to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Rell is primarily played as a support due to her crowd control, engage, and defensive buffs for allies.
Shattering Strike (Q) breaks enemy shields.
Ferromancy: Crash Down (W) knocks up enemies.
Magnet Storm (R) pulls and drags enemies, and Ferromancy: Mount Up (W) flips enemies, effectively stopping dashes.
Rell relies on shields from her Ferromancy: Crash Down (W), making her vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Renata Glasc is primarily played as a Support champion.
Handshake (Q) allows Renata to pull and throw enemies, which briefly displaces them.
Loyalty Program (E) provides shields to allies, making Renata's team vulnerable to shield reave effects.
Several of Renata's abilities, including Handshake (Q) and Loyalty Program (E), are projectiles that can be blocked or destroyed.
Renekton is primarily played in the Top lane due to his kit as a Fighter/Tank.
Ruthless Predator (W) when empowered destroys damage shields on the target.
Slice and Dice (E) provides two dashes for engaging and disengaging in combat.
Renekton's primary engage and escape tool, Slice and Dice (E), can be interrupted or countered by anti-dash abilities.
Rengar excels at ganking from brush and using his ultimate to assassinate targets, making him a strong Jungler.
Rengar's passive allows him to leap from brush, and his ultimate grants significant movement speed, enabling high mobility for engagements and escapes.
Rengar's W, Battle Roar, allows him to heal a significant portion of recent damage taken, contributing to his sustain in fights.
Rengar's empowered W, Battle Roar, cleanses him of all crowd control effects, rendering him unstoppable.
Rengar's ultimate, Thrill of the Hunt, camouflages him, granting him invisibility.
Rengar's ultimate, Thrill of the Hunt, grants him True Sight in a small area around the nearest enemy champion.
Rengar's healing from Battle Roar is significantly reduced by Grievous Wounds.
Rengar's mobility, especially his leaps, can be countered by effects that prevent or punish dashes and movement.
Riven is primarily played in the top lane due to her strong dueling and sustained damage, often leveraging short trades.
Riven's Broken Wings (Q) provides three dashes and Valor (E) provides another dash, giving her high mobility.
Riven's third cast of Broken Wings (Q) knocks up nearby enemies.
Riven relies heavily on multiple dashes for engagement and evasion, making her vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Riven's Valor (E) provides a shield, making her vulnerable to champions who can remove or ignore shields.
Rumble is commonly played as a Top laner.
Rumble utilizes a temporary shield from his Scrap Shield (W) ability, making him vulnerable to mechanics that destroy shields.
Ryze is primarily played as a Mid Laner.
Ryze's core damage abilities, Overload (Q) and Spell Flux (E), are projectiles that can be blocked.
Samira is a Marksman, primarily played in the Bot lane.
Samira's Blade Whirl (W) destroys enemy missiles.
Samira's Wild Rush (E) allows her to dash through enemies, and her passive allows her to dash to immobilized targets for further mobility.
Samira's kit relies heavily on dashes for engagement and repositioning, making her vulnerable to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Sejuani is a tanky jungler with strong ganking potential due to her crowd control abilities.
Sejuani's Arctic Assault (Q) knocks enemies into the air.
Sejuani's Arctic Assault (Q) and Glacial Prison (R) provide strong crowd control (knock-ups and stuns) that can interrupt enemy dashes.
Senna's kit is designed for a support role, offering healing, crowd control, and utility.
Senna's E, Curse of the Black Mist, grants camouflage and makes allies unselectable, functioning as invisibility.
Senna's Q, Piercing Darkness, provides consistent healing to allies, making her kit revolve around sustain.
Senna's high sustain from her Q makes her vulnerable to healing reduction effects.
Senna relies heavily on projectile abilities (Q, W, R) and her auto-attacks, all of which can be blocked.
Seraphine's Q, High Note, deals increased magic damage based on the target's missing Health percentage.
Seraphine heavily relies on shields for herself and her allies, making her vulnerable to effects that destroy shields.
Sett is commonly played as a Top lane champion.
Sett's passive, Pit Grit, grants him additional health regeneration based on his missing health.
Sett's Q, Knuckle Down, deals additional damage based off the target's max health, and his R, The Show Stopper, deals damage based on the grabbed enemy's bonus health.
Sett's ultimate, The Show Stopper, carries an enemy through the air and slams them into the ground, displacing them.
Sett's passive provides high sustain, which can be negated by Grievous Wounds.
Sett's W, Haymaker, provides a significant shield that can be countered by Shield Reave.
Shaco's kit, including Jack In The Box for camp clear and Deceive for ganks, makes him a highly effective jungler.
His Deceive (Q) ability grants him invisibility, allowing for stealthy engagements and escapes.
Deceive (Q) provides a short-range teleport and invisibility, granting significant mobility for positioning and evasion.
As a champion with high mobility from Deceive, Shaco can be vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes or restrict movement.
Shen is commonly played in the top lane due to his tankiness and dueling potential.
Shen's Twilight Assault (Q) deals magic damage based on the target's max health.
Shen's Spirit's Refuge (W) creates a defensive zone that blocks attacks against allied champions.
Shen's passive Ki Barrier and ultimate Stand United provide shields, making him vulnerable to abilities that remove or reduce shields.
Shyvana is a strong Jungler due to her clear speed with Burnout and ganking potential.
Shyvana's Flame Breath causes her basic attacks on marked targets to deal a percentage of their maximum Health as damage on-hit.
Shyvana's ultimate, Dragon's Descent, knocks enemies along her path towards her target location.
Singed is commonly played in the top lane due to his tankiness and ability to disrupt enemy lines.
Singed's Mega Adhesive grounds enemies, preventing them from using dashes.
Singed's Insanity Potion causes his Poison Trail to apply Grievous Wounds.
Singed's Fling ability throws enemies over his shoulder, which is a form of knock up/displacement.
Singed's Fling ability deals a percentage of the target's maximum health as magic damage.
Singed's Noxious Slipstream passive and Insanity Potion ultimate provide significant bursts of movement speed, making him highly mobile.
Sion is commonly played as a Tank/Fighter champion in the Top lane.
Decimating Smash (Q) and Unstoppable Onslaught (R) can knock up enemies, and Roar of the Slayer (E) can knock up enemies by knocking back minions.
Unstoppable Onslaught (R) makes Sion immune to crowd control during its channel.
Sion's passive, Glory in Death, deals bonus damage based on the target's maximum Health during his reanimation.
Sivir is tagged as a Marksman, typically played in the Bot lane.
Sivir's ultimate 'On The Hunt' grants a significant movement speed boost, and her passive 'Fleet of Foot' provides a burst of movement speed.
As a champion with High Mobility, Sivir is typically weak to Anti-Dash mechanics that can counter her movement.
Skarner is primarily played as a Jungler.
Skarner's Crystal Slash (Q) deals damage based on the target's maximum health.
Skarner heavily relies on his Crystalline Exoskeleton (W) shield for survivability and mobility, making him vulnerable to shield reave effects.
Sona is primarily played as a Support champion.
Sona's Aria of Perseverance (W) provides significant healing to herself and her allies.
Sona's High Sustain makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects that reduce her healing.
Soraka's primary role is Support.
Soraka's kit revolves around healing allies with Astral Infusion (W) and Wish (R), and healing herself with Starcall (Q).
Equinox (E) creates a zone that silences and roots enemies, stopping dashes within its area.
Soraka's High Sustain makes her vulnerable to Grievous Wounds, which reduce her healing effectiveness.
Swain is a mage with area control and sustain, often played in the mid lane.
Swain's passive Ravenous Flock and ultimate Demonic Ascension provide significant healing.
Swain's Vision of Empire (W) reveals champions hit.
Swain's Demonic Ascension (R) provides significant healing, which is countered by Grievous Wounds.
High mobility champions can easily dodge Swain's abilities and escape his ultimate's drain range.
Sylas is a mage/assassin commonly played in the mid lane.
Sylas's Kingslayer (W) provides significant healing, especially when he is low on health.
Sylas has high mobility through his Abscond/Abduct (E) dash and pull, and Kingslayer (W) lunge.
Sylas's Abduct (E recast) knocks up the first enemy hit.
Sylas's high sustain from Kingslayer (W) is countered by Grievous Wounds.
Sylas's dashes from Abscond (E) and Kingslayer (W) are vulnerable to Anti-Dash mechanics.
Syndra is primarily played in the Mid lane due to her burst damage and crowd control abilities.
Syndra's primary damage and crowd control abilities, including Dark Sphere and Unleashed Power, are projectiles that can be blocked.
Tahm Kench is categorized as a Support champion in his tags.
Tahm Kench's Q heals him on champion hit, and his E passively stores damage to heal him out of combat.
Tahm Kench's W, Abyssal Dive, knocks up all enemies in an area.
Tahm Kench has High Sustain through his Q and E, making him weak to Grievous Wounds.
Tahm Kench's E grants him a large shield, and his R shields allies, making him weak to Shield Reave.
Taliyah is primarily played as a control mage in the mid lane.
Her passive, Rock Surfing, grants increased movement speed near walls, and her ultimate, Weaver's Wall, allows for long-distance travel.
Her Seismic Shove (W) ability can knock back enemies in a chosen direction.
Her Unraveled Earth (E) creates a minefield that detonates if enemies dash or are pushed/pulled through it.
Her primary damage ability, Threaded Volley (Q), relies on projectiles which can be blocked by abilities like Wind Wall.
Despite her own mobility, champions with strong anti-dash mechanics can limit her ability to escape or reposition effectively.
Talon is a high-burst assassin champion often played in the Mid lane due to his roaming potential and ability to quickly eliminate targets.
Talon's ultimate ability, Shadow Assault, makes him invisible for a short duration.
Talon possesses high mobility through his Assassin's Path ability, which allows him to vault over terrain, and Shadow Assault, which grants increased movement speed.
Talon's kit heavily relies on dashes and movement, making him vulnerable to abilities that can stop or prevent dashes.
Taric's primary role is Support, as indicated by his tags.
Taric's Starlight's Touch (Q) provides significant healing to allies, which is empowered by his passive to reduce cooldowns, making him a high sustain champion.
Taric's significant healing from Starlight's Touch (Q) makes him vulnerable to effects that reduce healing.
Taric's Bastion (W) grants a shield to an ally, making his team vulnerable to abilities that reave shields.
Teemo is commonly played in the Top lane due to his ranged harass and zone control.
Teemo's passive, Guerrilla Warfare, allows him to become invisible when standing still or in brush.
Teemo's Blinding Dart blinds enemies, causing their auto-attacks to miss.
Teemo's Noxious Traps reveal enemies that step on them.
Thresh is primarily played as a Support champion.
Thresh's Death Sentence (Q) grants true sight on the target.
Thresh's Flay (E) can pull or push enemies, acting as a knock up.
Thresh's The Box (R) creates a prison that significantly slows enemies, hindering dashes and escapes.
Tristana is a Marksman, commonly played in the Bot lane.
Tristana's Rocket Jump (W) provides significant mobility, and its cooldown can be reset.
Tristana's Buster Shot (R) knocks back the target.
As an ADC, Tristana relies heavily on auto-attacks and her ultimate, which are projectiles and can be blocked.
Tristana's primary escape and engagement tool is Rocket Jump (W), making her vulnerable to effects that stop dashes.
Trundle's kit makes him a strong duelist and objective taker in the jungle.
Trundle is a common pick in the top lane due to his strong dueling and sustain.
Trundle's passive heals him upon nearby enemy deaths, and his Frozen Domain ability significantly boosts all healing he receives.
Subjugate deals magic damage based on a percentage of the target's maximum Health.
Pillar of Ice briefly knocks back enemies directly over it.
Chomp reduces the target's Attack Damage, weakening their auto attacks.
Trundle relies on high sustain from his passive and W, making him vulnerable to healing reduction effects.
Tryndamere is commonly played in the Top lane.
Tryndamere's Q, Bloodlust, allows him to heal significantly by consuming Fury.
Tryndamere's E, Spinning Slash, provides a frequent dash, especially with critical strikes.
Due to his High Sustain from Bloodlust, Tryndamere is weak to Grievous Wounds.
As a High Mobility champion relying on Spinning Slash, Tryndamere is weak to Anti-Dash abilities.
Tryndamere heavily relies on auto-attacks for damage, making him vulnerable to anti-auto attack mechanics.
Twisted Fate is a mage champion who is primarily played in the Mid lane.
Twisted Fate's ultimate ability, Destiny, grants True Sight of all enemy champions.
Twitch is primarily played as a Marksman in the Bot lane.
Twitch's Ambush (Q) grants him Camouflage, providing invisibility.
Twitch's primary engagement and escape tool is his invisibility (Camouflage), which is directly countered by True Sight.
Udyr is noted as one of the best junglers in the game in his ally tips.
Udyr's Turtle Stance heals him for a percentage of his maximum health on every third attack, providing consistent sustain.
Udyr's Turtle Stance provides High Sustain, making him vulnerable to Grievous Wounds.
Urgot is commonly played as a Top lane champion due to his durable fighter playstyle.
Urgot's ultimate, Fear Beyond Death, executes enemies below 25% of their maximum health.
Varus is a Marksman champion primarily played in the Bot lane.
Varus's Blighted Quiver (W) allows his abilities to deal magic damage based on the target's maximum health.
Varus's Hail of Arrows (E) applies Grievous Wounds, reducing enemy healing and regeneration.
Varus's primary damage ability, Piercing Arrow (Q), and ultimate, Chain of Corruption (R), are projectiles that can be blocked.
Vayne is a Marksman champion primarily played in the Bot lane.
Vayne's Tumble (Q) and Final Hour (R) grant dashes, bonus movement speed, and invisibility during Tumble.
Vayne's Silver Bolts (W) deals percentage max health true damage on every third consecutive attack or ability hit.
Vayne gains Invisibility during Tumble (Q) while her Final Hour (R) is active.
Vayne's Condemn (E) knocks back the target and stuns them if they collide with terrain.
As a champion with high mobility from dashes, Vayne is weak to Anti-Dash mechanics that can prevent her repositioning.
Veigar is typically played in the Mid lane as a scaling burst mage.
Veigar's Event Horizon (E) stuns enemies that pass through its perimeter, stopping dashes.
Veigar's ultimate, Primordial Burst (R), deals increased magic damage based on the target's missing health.
Veigar's Dark Matter (W) is a delayed area-of-effect spell that can be easily dodged by highly mobile champions, and he lacks mobility himself.
Vel'Koz is a mage champion with long-range poke and area-of-effect abilities, commonly played in the Mid lane.
Tectonic Disruption (E) causes an area to explode, knocking up enemies.
Vel'Koz relies on his Plasma Fission (Q) projectile for poke and damage, which can be blocked by enemy abilities.
Vel'Koz has low mobility and is vulnerable to champions with high mobility who can easily close the gap.
Vel'Koz's ultimate, Life Form Disintegration Ray (R), is a channeled ability that can be interrupted by knock ups.
Vex is primarily played as a Mage in the Mid lane.
Vex's passive, Doom 'n Gloom, interrupts enemy dashes.
Vi is primarily played as a jungler, utilizing her mobility and crowd control for ganks.
Vi's ultimate ability, Cease and Desist (R), knocks up her target.
Vi's Denting Blows (W) deals bonus physical damage based on the target's maximum health.
Vi becomes unstoppable while dashing towards her target with Cease and Desist (R).
Vi's Cease and Desist (R) reveals the enemy champion she targets.
Vi's Vault Breaker (Q) applies a knockback and Cease and Desist (R) applies a knockup, both of which can interrupt enemy dashes.
Viego's W allows him to dash, his E grants increased movement speed in the mist, and his R is a teleport.
Viego's E (Harrowed Path) grants him camouflage while inside the mist.
Viego's Q passive deals bonus percent current Health damage on-hit.
Viego's R (Heartbreaker) knocks back nearby enemies.
Viego's mobility, including dashes and teleports, makes him vulnerable to champions with anti-dash mechanics.
Viktor is a Mage champion typically played in the Mid lane.
Viktor's Gravity Field (W) slows and stuns enemies in an area, effectively stopping dashes.
Viktor's Siphon Power (Q) grants him a shield, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Vladimir's primary tag is 'Mage', which typically plays in the Mid lane.
Vladimir's Q (Transfusion), W (Sanguine Pool), and R (Hemoplague) all provide significant healing, making his kit revolve around sustain.
Vladimir's W (Sanguine Pool) makes him untargetable, allowing him to ignore incoming crowd control and damage.
Vladimir has high sustain from his abilities, making him weak to Grievous Wounds which reduces healing.
Volibear is a brawler champion commonly played in the jungle role due to his strong ganks and clear speed.
Volibear gains significant movement speed with Thundering Smash (Q) and can leap with Stormbringer (R).
Volibear heals for a percentage of his missing health when Frenzied Maul (W) is recast on a marked target.
Due to his High Sustain from Frenzied Maul (W), Volibear is vulnerable to Grievous Wounds effects.
Volibear's Sky Splitter (E) deals magic damage plus a percentage of the target's max health.
Volibear's Sky Splitter (E) grants him a significant shield, making him vulnerable to Shield Reave effects.
Warwick is a fighter/tank champion commonly played in the Jungle role.
Warwick's passive, Q ability, and R ultimate all provide significant healing, especially when low on health.
Warwick gains significant movement speed towards low health enemies with Blood Hunt (W) and his ultimate Infinite Duress (R) is a long-range leap that scales with movement speed.
Warwick's Jaws of the Beast (Q) deals magic damage based on the target's maximum health.
Warwick has high sustain, making him weak to effects that reduce healing.
Warwick has high mobility, making him weak to abilities that stop dashes or restrict movement in an area.
Xayah is a Marksman, a role typically played in the Bot lane.
Xayah's Featherstorm (R) makes her untargetable, allowing her to avoid crowd control and damage.
Many of Xayah's core damaging abilities, including her basic attacks and Double Daggers (Q), are projectiles, making her vulnerable to abilities that block them.
Xerath is a long-range mage commonly played in the mid lane due to his ability to control space and clear waves.
Xerath's core damage abilities, Arcanopulse, Shocking Orb, and Rite of the Arcane, are all projectiles that can be blocked by abilities like Wind Wall.
Xin Zhao is a strong initiator and ganker, fitting well into the Jungle role.
Three Talon Strike (Q) knocks opponents into the air with its third attack.
Crescent Guard (R) deals physical damage based on the target's current Health.
Yasuo is commonly played in the Mid lane due to his strong dueling potential and mobility.
Yasuo's Wind Wall (W) creates a barrier that blocks all enemy projectiles.
Yasuo's Steel Tempest (Q) at 2 stacks fires a whirlwind that knocks enemies airborne, and his ultimate Last Breath (R) works on airborne targets.
Yasuo's Sweeping Blade (E) allows him to dash through multiple enemies repeatedly, granting him high mobility in combat.
Yasuo's passive shield, Way of the Wanderer, makes him susceptible to abilities that reave shields.
Yasuo relies heavily on his Sweeping Blade (E) for mobility, making him vulnerable to abilities that restrict or punish dashes.
Yone is commonly played in the Mid lane due to his assassin/fighter nature and strong burst damage.
Yone's Mortal Steel (Q) on 2 stacks knocks up enemies, and his ultimate Fate Sealed (R) knocks up enemies.
Yone's Soul Unbound (E) grants significant move speed and allows him to return to a prior position, and his ultimate Fate Sealed (R) blinks him to a target location.
Yone's Spirit Cleave (W) deals percent maximum health physical and magic damage.
Yone relies on his dashes (Q3) and mobility (E, R) to engage and disengage, making him vulnerable to abilities that stop dashes.
Yorick is commonly played as a top lane Fighter/Tank champion.
Dark Procession (W) summons a destructible wall that blocks enemy movement, effectively stopping dashes within its area.
Mourning Mist (E) deals magic damage based on the target's current Health.
Yuumi's primary role is Support, as indicated by her tags.
Yuumi's Zoomies (E) provides significant healing to herself or her attached ally, and her passive Bop 'n' Block provides periodic shields and mana restoration, making her kit revolve around sustain.
Yuumi's passive Bop 'n' Block provides shields, making her weak to Shield Reave effects.
Yuumi relies on her Zoomies (E) for high sustain healing, making her weak to Grievous Wounds.
Yuumi's You and Me! (W) allows her to instantly attach to an ally, becoming untargetable and mimicking their movement, effectively granting her high mobility through her partner.
Yuumi's You and Me! (W) involves a dash to an ally, which can be interrupted by Anti-Dash mechanics if she is targetable during the brief dash window or if her partner is affected by anti-mobility.
Zac is primarily played as a jungler due to his ganking potential and tankiness.
Zac's passive Cell Division allows him to restore health by reabsorbing goo chunks from his abilities.
Zac's Stretching Strikes (Q), Elastic Slingshot (E), and Let's Bounce! (R) all provide knock ups.
Zac's Elastic Slingshot (E) is a powerful, long-range dash, providing significant mobility for engages and ganks.
Zac's Unstable Matter (W) deals magic damage based on a percentage of the enemy's maximum health.
Zac's primary sustain comes from reabsorbing goo, making him vulnerable to healing reduction effects like Grievous Wounds.
Zac's Elastic Slingshot (E), a key engagement tool, can be interrupted during its charge by various crowd control, making him weak to anti-dash abilities.
Zed is a prominent assassin champion typically played in the Mid lane.
Zed's Living Shadow (W) and Death Mark (R) provide multiple dashes for high mobility.
Zed's reliance on dashes makes him vulnerable to champions with anti-dash abilities.
Zeri is a Marksman, which typically plays in the Bot lane.
Zeri's E, Spark Surge, is a terrain-vaulting dash, and her R, Lightning Crash, grants stacking movement speed upon hitting enemies, making her highly mobile.
Zeri's Q, Burst Fire, when fully charged, deals bonus magic damage based on the target's max health.
Zeri's primary damage sources, Burst Fire (Q) and Ultrashock Laser (W), are projectile-based, making her vulnerable to projectile blocking abilities.
Zeri's primary escape and engagement tool is her E dash, making her vulnerable to anti-dash mechanics.
As a long-range mage, Ziggs is typically played in the mid lane to control objectives and poke enemies from a safe distance.
Ziggs's Satchel Charge (W) knocks enemies back upon detonation.
Ziggs's Satchel Charge (W) can be used to knock himself over walls for quick escapes or chases, providing a burst of mobility.
All of Ziggs's primary damage abilities (Q, E, R) are projectiles, making him highly vulnerable to abilities that block or destroy projectiles.
Zilean is primarily played as a support champion based on his utility-focused kit and tags.
Zilean's primary damage and stun ability, Time Bomb (Q), is a projectile that can be blocked.
Zoe is primarily played as a Mid lane Mage.
Zoe's Spell Thief grants bonus movement speed upon casting a spell or summoner spell, and Portal Jump allows her to blink and reposition.
Zoe's reliance on movement speed and short-range blinks makes her vulnerable to champions with anti-dash abilities that can restrict her repositioning.
Zyra is tagged as a 'Support' champion, indicating her primary role.
Zyra's Rampant Growth (W) seeds grant True Sight of enemy champions that step on them.
Zyra's ultimate ability, Stranglethorns (R), Knocks Up enemies as the vines contract.
